column4: suppose i hit ctrl alt f2... how do i get away from that screen??
the f1 -6 keys go to the console 1-6 NORMALLY X is running on '7' but ive seen it also run on 8 or 9 or hither.
you install the deb..  then type the name of whatever program/binaries it installed to run them from teh command line
so the program is called "bomb", i type bomb but i get: bomb: error while loading shared libraries: libpng.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
looks like some of the support libs it wants are not installed.
how do i find out what libraries i need?
I have to wonder why installign the deb did not pull them in.  Could be its a different version in ubuntu and thats the issue
libpng.so.2 is the library i need?
yes. libpng
well can i get it manually somehow?
the bot just stated its in the libpng3 package.
how do i install that library?
install  the libpng3 package.
umm yea im willing to do so.. but how?
sudo apt-get libpng3 ?
via the package manager tools you like to use.. are you trying to do some 'advanced' stuff befor learning the fundamentals of the package manager system?
sudo apt-get install whatever
E: Couldn't find package libping3
spell it properly
yea just figured
the program may been compiled to use an older version of the Lib. You may need to recompile from source to use the newer. or track down the older lib and install it.
